title: Include document reference in serde errors
body:
Imagine, in your complex application, you have something that queries many documents. One of the queries fail due to some serde error, but you have no idea why. This PR adds the failed document path to the error to help with that case.

Example of how a log from our own application would benefit from this PR:
```diff
ERROR [SPAN - EVENT] Failed to find user: Internal server error

Caused by:
        Failed to find user in Firestore
Caused by:
-       serde: missing field `email`
+       serde: missing field `email` in document 'users/RHEHbElQhdcFxqVhW8DlYTT6UNv2'
Caused by:
        missing field `email`
```

title: Add method to combine filters
body:
Useful for cases where you want to combine multiple existing filters into one. For example, you might automatically generate Firestore filters based on some filters of your own - this now becomes an easy fold:

```rs
my_filters
    .into_iter()
    .map(MyFilter::to_firestore_filter)
    .fold(Filter::empty(), Filter::combine);
```

title: Add generic query method
body:
Adds a new, generic `run_query` method that supports getting all docs in a collection or collection group as well as filtering those documents. It's essentially all of the current query methods combined into a single one.

See the updated docs for examples and tests.

Additionally, this PR makes pagination possible via `limit` and `offset`.

title: Publish crate on crates.io
body:
Fireplace is now available on crates.io: https://crates.io/crates/fireplace!

This is already published, but let's get the changes into `main` as well. :)

title: Add update_document_merge method
body: Adds a new method `update_document_merge` which is an alternative to `set_document_merge` in the same way that `update_document` is an alternative to `set_document`. It simply requires the document to exist before writing to it.

title: Implement additional query operators
body: Adding some operators

title: Add method to obtain document reference for firestore documents
body: The `id` field is the full path to the resource - i.e. `projects/{project_id}/databases/{database_id}/documents/{document_path}`. The new `document_reference` method allows extracting the `document_path` segment into a `DocumentReference`.

title: Add count method to Firestore client
body:
Add a `.count(query)` method to `FirestoreClient` that returns the number of documents that the query would match. Rather than retrieving all the documents across the network, the counting is done server-side by Firestore.

This PR introduces a new trait, `FirestoreQuery`, which will make it possible to be generic over different query types. Currently, it is implemented for collection group queries, collection queries, and plain collection references (i.e. all docs in a collection).

title: Remove unnecessary explicit lifetimes
body:
In #28, it was necessary to make lifetimes more explicit. However, it seems that was only necessary for `query_internal`, not its callers.

Does it hurt to have these explicit lifetimes? No. But the signatures might just look *slightly* cleaner and more readable without them.

title: Add prefix to serde and grpc error messages
body:
Adds a prefix to the errors emitted by serde and tonic.

Before, only the bottommost error was shown. With this PR, you would know that the error came from serde by just looking at the error message itself:

```
        serde: premature end of input
Caused by:
        premature end of input
```

Closes #29

title: Allow users to obtain document metadata when querying
body:
This PR:
- Adds a new type `FirestoreDocument<T>` that represents a document's metadata (creation time, last modification time, etc) and its data of type `T`.
- Adds a new function `collection_group_query_with_metadata` to the public API.
- Adds a new function `query_internal_with_metadata` to the private API. This function can be reused for future public API functions (for example `get_document_with_metadata`)
- Makes lifetimes in `FirestoreClient` functions very explicit to allow `query_internal` to use `query_internal_with_metadata`.

title: Implement update and delete for existing documents
body:
This PR implements and tests the following two functions:

- `update_document`
- `delete_existing_document`

They're different from `set_document` and `delete_document`, in that they assume that the document already exists, and will return a new error `DocumentNotFound` if they don't.

In a scenario where we wish to make sure that the document really does exist before updating or deleting it, we can save resources by using these functions instead of using a combination of `get_document` and `set/delete_document`,

title: Use more clean way to obtain stringified type ID for reference serialization
body: Before, I used the implementation of `Debug` to obtain a string version of the type ID.. which was *jank*. I noticed that `TypeId` implements `Hash`, so we can use that instead. 🚀

title: Add AsRef implementations for reference types
body: This should be handy for quite a lot of use cases. It will also allow us to use `impl AsRef<...Reference>` in the future for a nicer interface in the Firestore client.

title: Serialize and deserialize reference types
body:
- Save and fetch `DocumentReference` and `CollectionReference` types in the database via `serde`.
   - The types are saved as references in Firestore via Serialize
   - Reference types are visited as strings during deserialization, so you can deserialize with `...Reference`, `String`, or anything that can be made using a string
- Strip the beginning of the resource path when deserializing
- Add `PartialEq` to collection and document references so you can query them for equal references in the database.
- Instead of serializing up-front when constructing a filter for a query, postpone serialization until we actually need it in the query call. This also means we don't need to return a result after `filter` - this is a breaking change but for the better. We use type erasure from `erased_serde` to accomplish this.

title: Allow user to delete documents in Firestore
body: The title should be rather self-explanatory.

title: Refactor get_documents
body:
@avborup suggested I just refactor the `get_documents` function entirely, replacing the auto-pagination logic with a simple call to `query_internal` without a filter.

This was prompted by an issue in another project, where a future could not be sent between threads safely. I'm still not sure what caused that issue, but it doesn't occur with this change.

title: Let user fetch all documents in collection
body:
This would be possible to do with an "empty" query, but I'm not sure that's the best way to do it. I've used the official `ListDocuments` call in the Firestore gRPC service. It requires pagination, however, so I've used `stream::unfold` to generate a stream that automatically requests all the pages, while the user simply sees one continuous stream.

Closes #16.

title: Add collection group query support to Firestore
body:
Closes #15

Additionally, it fixes a small bug where all erroneus responses for any query-like method was discarded, making it *very hard* to debug why an empty list was returned.... Didn't at all spend too much time on that... It's been fixed now so errors from the Firestore gRPC API are preserved, such as "missing index".

title: Fix conflicting tests
body: This bad boy was causing some randomness in test runs since it'd remove the `toppings` field, which another test depends on. The tests should not be working against the same documents, which this PR remedies.

title: Fix bug to allow creating documents in nested collections
body: Closes #12.

title: Make auth a more Admin SDK-library than a normal client library
body:
There are a few things going on here. Changes can be summed up as:
- All external operations take `&self` compared to before where some could take `&mut self` (by using interior mutability via `RwLock`)
- Replace Firebase API key with service account-based OAuth2 token because that's the only way you can act as an admin
- Replace the old auth interface with a new interface that reflects Google's Admin SDK more
- Make `ServiceAccount` the only thing the user needs to provide in order to initialise the clients
- Restructure the code for handling JWTs and authorization
- Add some more auth client methods such as fetching user info, generating custom and ID tokens, and setting custom claims

title: Initial Firebase auth setup
body: See #3 for tracking issue.

title: Make host URL and option
body: This allows you to, for example, connect to a local Firebase emulator.

title: Implement some things necessary for our use-case
Initial library with basic Firestore support
body:
The extracted work from https://github.com/Filify-app/filify-api/pull/40.

See #2 for what has been implemented.

There are some `TODO` comments. We'll fix them later.

Should we rename from Fireblaze to Fireplace to get them cozy vibes? 👀 🔥
